title: Unknown Direct X error

embed.description: after champion select, The League of Legends client closes before the summoning screen giving me an error stating "Unknown directx error. please make sure your video card supports shader model 2.0 and that it is using drivers from the manufacture."

body: Been trying to play and fix this issue but It wont work for me... I have a low priority queue now. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling it; Deleting the Config; Repair launcher; all hasn't worked. Help pls. Played plenty one this Cpu then one day {{summoner:4}}  didn't work, and now I have been penalized 2 times...

replies.body:
This is a fairly uncommon issue that typically occurs if there are issues with certain prerequisite files that League relies on. You should be able to resolve this with the steps below:

1. Run **all available windows updates** to ensure your computer is the most up to date.
2. Install [**this standalone package**](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=34429) from Microsoft to ensure your DirectX 9 files are complete and not fragmented in any way.

Let me know if this helped resolve the issue.

Hey That actually fixed it the standalone package that is... Do you know if they will take away my leaverbuster?
{{champion:32}} {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

I'm glad to hear that fixed it! Unfortunately, we're unable to remove Leaverbuster penalties for any reason. Regardless of intent, your absence from a match negatively impacts everyone in the match, which is a big reason why the system treats all disconnections (intentional or unintentional) the same.

If you have any other questions, let me know.
I have the same problem everything is up to date and i tried to install the standalone but is wasn't combatable with my windows 10?
it seems to be very common, happening to me right now and nothing is working..
